subject: Re: [junit] Re: displaying tests results/errors in a servlet/jsp
msgSnippet: ... We do that on my project. We use a home modified version of servletui, that first appeared in a JavaWorld acticle. See:
messageBody:
>I'm looking for a servlet/jsp way to use the test suite.
>http://<production.app.url>/AllTests

We do that on my project. We use a home modified version of servletui, that
first appeared in a JavaWorld acticle.

See:
http://sourceforge.net/projects/junitservlet/
http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-05-2000/jw-0526-testinfect.html
As you can read on the sourceforge projet page : "This project is now
retired. Please see http://jakarta.apache.org/commons/cactus/index.html for
its successor."

But still, it's the simplest thing that could work in a lot of cases.

Mathieu

----- Original Message -----
From: Alain RAVET
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, September 27, 2001 4:49 PM
Subject: [junit] Re: displaying tests results/errors in a servlet/jsp


--- In junit@y..., "Erik Hanson" <ehanson@n...> wrote:
> Would a JUnit applet be sufficient? That should be pretty easy to
implement.

It would be too much :)

I'm looking for a servlet/jsp way to use the test suite.
http://<production.app.url>/AllTests


Alain Ravet
Brussels, Belgium
